revised_title: Investigation of the Colouring Matters in the Compound Ascidian Diazona violacea
tldr: The author investigates the colouring matters in the compound ascidian Diazona violacea and concludes that the green colour likely results from a chlorophyll-like body, possibly due to a symbiotic alga. The study also examines the pigments' chemical properties and their resemblance to chlorophyll found in plants.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
